meanings.definition: Separated by a distance in space or time.
meanings.sent1: The two houses were far apart from each other.
meanings.sent2: The friends lived in different cities, miles apart.
meanings.sent3: The lonely tree stood apart from the rest of the forest.
meanings.sent4: Her unique perspective set her apart from the crowd.
meanings.sent5: The old bridge was falling apart, each plank separated from the next.

meanings.sent1: She tore the paper apart in frustration.
meanings.sent2: The vase fell and shattered apart on the floor.
meanings.sent3: The magician pulled the scarf apart to reveal a dove.
meanings.sent4: The storm ripped the sail apart, leaving shreds behind.
meanings.sent5: The cookie crumbled apart with each bite, leaving a trail of crumbs.

meanings.sent1: She sat apart from the group during lunch.
meanings.sent2: The shy child stood apart from the noisy crowd.
meanings.sent3: The cat preferred to sleep apart from the other pets.
meanings.sent4: The old man sat apart from the bustling activity of the fair.
meanings.sent5: The artist worked quietly apart from the other students in the studio.

meanings.definition: In a state of being separate or isolated.
meanings.sent1: The abandoned house looked dark and apart from the rest of the neighborhood.
meanings.sent2: She felt apart from her classmates after moving to a new school.
meanings.sent3: The broken toy lay apart from the other toys in the corner.
meanings.sent4: The injured bird huddled apart from the flock, seeking solitude.
meanings.sent5: The old lighthouse stood tall and apart on the rocky cliff, guiding ships safely.
